com.intel.idrml.iagent.framework

Class AmsClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.intel.idrml.iagent.framework.AmsClient

  • public class AmsClient
extends java.lang.Object
    The AmsClient class is a collection of methods to manage configuration file.

    In one APP, there is one AmsClient instance. AmsClient.getInstance() can be used to get the singleton instance; Any action to create a new instance by "new" is NOT allowed.
    Since:
    Feb 2017

    • Method Detail

      • addCheckpoint

        public int addCheckpoint(java.lang.String targetType,
                         java.lang.String targetId)
        Method to download the configuration information of devices, groups or resources. This method is synchronous and the configuration information will be download and stored locally in file format.
        Parameters:
        targetType - The configuration of which to be download and monitor, including global, device, group, resource and so on.
        targetId - This parameter has different meaning when targetType is different. For example, targetId will be device ID when targetType isDEVICE_ID, while it will be resource URI if targetType is RESOURCE_META.
        Returns:
        0: success , -1: fail

      • deleteCheckpoint

        public int deleteCheckpoint(java.lang.String targetType,
                            java.lang.String targetId)
        Method to delete the download action for the configuration information of devices, groups or resources.
        Parameters:
        targetType - The configuration of which to be download and monitor, including global, device, group, resource and so on.
        targetId - This parameter has different meaning when targetType is different. For example, targetId will be device ID when targetType isDEVICE_ID, while it will be resource URI if targetType is RESOURCE_META.
        Returns:
        0: success , -1: fail

      • registerConfigStatus

        public java.lang.String registerConfigStatus(OnConfigurationListener eventHandler)
        Method to monitor the change of configuration information of devices, groups or resources. This method is asynchronous and the configuration information will be download and stored locally in file format. APP shall try to read and parse the configuration file when callback eventHandler is called.
        Parameters:
        eventHandler - This parameter is event handler when configuration information has been download locally from server.
        Returns:
        0: success , -1: fail
        See Also:
        OnConfigurationListener

      • deregisterConfigStatus

        public int deregisterConfigStatus()
        Method to delete monitor for the change of configuration information of devices, groups or resources. This method is synchronous.
        Returns:
        0: success , -1: fail
        See Also:
        OnConfigurationListener

      • setProductID

        public int setProductID(java.lang.String productId)
        Method to change the product ID which will be used for APP upgrade.
        Parameters:
        productId - ID of the product.
        Returns:
        0: success , -1: fail

      • getConfigFilePath

        public static java.lang.String getConfigFilePath(java.lang.String configFilePathLocal,
                                                 java.lang.String targetType,
                                                 java.lang.String targetId)
        Method to compose the full path of the configure file, this is static method as a utility for handling configuration file. This API shall work with OnConfigurationListener, it means that it will be used in callback of OnConfigurationListener since all parameters come from OnConfigurationListener.
        Parameters:
        configFilePathLocal - Local configure file name on the gateway.
        targetType - The same as that in API addCheckpoint.
        targetId - The same as that in API addCheckpoint.
        Returns:
        0: success , -1: fail
        See Also:
        OnConfigurationListener

      • getInstance

        public static AmsClient getInstance(java.lang.String appName)
